hero.title: Production-ready architecture for demanding financial teams.
hero.copy: HL Deals showcases how to deploy a modern production-ready stack: secure AWS infrastructure, automated deployment pipelines, and a frontend that scales globally. This page summarizes the engineering behind the demo for tech leads, recruiters, and decision makers.

snapshot.title: Stack snapshot
items: Backend: ASP.NET Core 8, EF Core, JWT
Infra: AWS VPC, CloudFront, ALB, ECS Fargate, RDS SQL Server
IaC & DevOps: Terraform, Docker, Amazon ECR

architecture.title: AWS architecture
architecture.note: TLS certificates come from ACM (us-east-1) and protect both CloudFront and the ALB.

clients.title: Users
clients.copy: Browsers and mobile apps. All traffic runs over HTTPS.

route53.title: Amazon Route 53
route53.copy: Alias hl-web → CloudFront. Alias hl-api → ALB.

cloudfront.title: Amazon CloudFront
cloudfront.copy: Serves the SPA. Origin Access Identity + ACM.

s3.title: Amazon S3
s3.copy: Private bucket hl-deals-web-dev. Static assets and index.html.

ecs.title: Amazon ECS Fargate
ecs.copy: ASP.NET Core 8 container. Minimal security group.

rds.title: Amazon RDS (SQL Server)
rds.copy: Managed instance. Access restricted to ECS SG.

pipeline.title: Automated deployment flow
pipeline.copy: From local scripts to publishing on ECS and CloudFront.

build.title: Local build
build.copy: api-build-push-local.sh runs dotnet publish, Docker build, and push to ECR. ui-build-push-local.sh runs ng build and prepares assets.

registry.title: Registry
registry.copy: Versioned images in Amazon ECR for ECS Fargate.

frontend.title: Front-end
frontend.copy: Assets synced to S3 bucket and CloudFront cache invalidated.

backend.title: Back-end
backend.copy: New task definition registered and ECS service updated for the API.

security.title: Security & reliability
security.copy: The demo follows production-grade patterns: valid certificates, network segmentation, secret management, and reproducible deployments. It is designed to demonstrate audit-ready practices.
items: End-to-end encrypted traffic with ACM certificates.
Private S3 bucket accessible only through the Origin Access Identity.
JWT signed with rotatable keys and CORS configured for trusted clients.
Private subnets for ECS and RDS with minimal security groups.
Deployment scripts that enforce cache invalidations and consistent versions.
